title: Fairy heavy showers expected in parts of the island
byline: The Meteorology Department says showers or thundershowers will occur at times in the Eastern, Southern, and Uva provinces and in the Matale, Nuwara Eliya, and Polonnaruwa districts.

title: Ramadan fasting begins for Sri Lankan Muslims
byline: The Ramadan fasting begins today (02), with Muslims in Sri Lanka observing a month-long period of fasting starting from this date.

title: Israel agrees on US plan for temporary ceasefire in Gaza, PM’s office says
byline: Israel will adopt the proposal by U.S. President Donald Trump’s envoy, Steve Witkoff, for a temporary ceasefire in Gaza for the Ramadan and Passover periods, the prime minister’s office said early on Sunday, hours after the first phase of the previously agreed ceasefire was set to expire.

title: Special committee appointed to address crop damage caused by wild animals
byline: A special committee has been appointed to address crop damage caused by wild animals and to provide essential recommendations for managing the animals responsible.

title: Fairly heavy showers expected in parts of the island
byline: The Meteorology Department says showers or thundershowers will occur at times in the Eastern, Southern, and Uva provinces and in the Matale, Nuwara Eliya, and Polonnaruwa districts.

title: Two ex-Army Intelligence personnel arrested over Keith Noyahr abduction
byline: Two former Sri Lanka Army intelligence personnel have been arrested on suspicion of being involved in the abduction and assault on journalist Keith Noyahr in May 2008, the Police Media Division said.

title: Suspect arrested while transporting illegal painkillers worth Rs. 1 billion
byline: The Colombo Crimes Division (CCD) has arrested a person while transporting a large stock of illegal painkiller pills in a van on the Colombo-Negombo main road, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: One injured as police give chase, open fire at truck transporting drugs
byline: Police officers have given chase of a truck loaded with sand and suspected drugs, which failed to heed their orders to halt at a checkpoint in Point Pedro, and have opened fire at the vehicle in Valvettithurai, the Police Media Division said.

title: CPC assures no risk of fuel shortage in the country
byline: The Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (CPC) has assured that there is no risk of a fuel shortage in the country at any point.

title: At least 37 dead and dozens injured in bus crash in Bolivia
byline: A crash involving two buses in Bolivia left at least 37 people dead and dozens injured in the western Potosi region, police and local authorities said on Saturday.

title: Two police officers including SI arrested for soliciting bribe
byline: Two police officers including a Sub-Inspector (SI) and a Constable have been arrested in Galnewa area for attempting and aiding to solicit a bribe of Rs. 30,000, the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) said.

title: Sluice gates of several major reservoirs and tanks opened after heavy rains
byline: The sluice gates of several major reservoirs and tanks have been opened following heavy rainfall in the Mahaweli B zone, including the Polonnaruwa District, over the past several days.

title: Dates announced for special exposition of Sacred Tooth Relic
byline: The Diyawadana Nilame of the Sri Dalada Maligawa, Pradeep Nilanga Dela, has announced the dates and times for the special exposition of the Sacred Tooth Relic, which will be open to the general public after the Sinhala and Tamil New Year.

title: Ex-Army Intelligence personnel arrested over Keith Noyahr abduction granted bail
byline: The two former Sri Lanka Army Intelligence personnel, who were arrested on suspicion of being involved in the abduction and assault of journalist Keith Noyahr in May 2008, have been granted bail by the Mount Lavinia Magistrate’s Court, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: Israel blocks entry of all humanitarian aid into Gaza
byline: Israel has blocked the entry of all humanitarian aid into Gaza as it demands Hamas agree to a US plan for a ceasefire extension.

title: Discussion held with manufacturers to reduce salt price
byline: A discussion has been recently held between the Consumer Affairs Authority (CAA) and salt manufacturing companies at the CAA’s head office.

title: Weather advisory issued for severe lightning
byline: The Meteorology Department has issued an ‘Amber’ advisory for severe lightning for several provinces and districts.

title: Navy brings ashore critically ill fisherman for urgent treatment
byline: The Sri Lanka Navy has swiftly responded to bring ashore a critically ill fisherman and transfer him to the General Hospital, Trincomalee for urgent medical attention on Saturday (01).

title: TN Governor meets protesting fishermen, promises to escalate SL Navy issue
byline: Tamil Nadu Governor RN Ravi has engaged with Indian fishermen protesting the Sri Lankan Navy’s arrest of 32 of their colleagues and seizure of five boats on February 23.

title: Oscars take the stage on Sunday with best picture up for grabs
byline: The Academy Awards, the highest honors in the film business, take place on Sunday with no clear frontrunner among “Anora,” “The Brutalist,” “Conclave” and other movies contending for the prestigious best picture prize.

title: US firm Firefly scores its first moon landing with Blue Ghost spacecraft
byline: Firefly Aerospace succeeded in its first attempt to land on the moon with its uncrewed Blue Ghost spacecraft on Sunday, kicking off a two-week research mission as a handful of private firms compete to reach the frontlines of a global moon race.
